thread.title: Lambeth crash: Man fights for life after being hit by bus
thread.title_full: Lambeth crash: Man fights for life after being hit by bus

author: Sean Morrison
title: Lambeth crash: Man fights for life after being hit by bus
text:
Thursday 23 March 2017 16:29 GMT Click to followThe Evening Standard Crash: Pedestrian fights for life after being hit by bus in Lambeth Twitter/@ShoebridgeC 
A man is fighting for his life in hospital after being hit by a bus in south-east London. 
Paramedics treated the man in Lambeth Palace Road before rushing him to a major trauma centre shortly after 8am on Thursday. 
Officers confirmed that the man, aged in his 50s, was in critical condition in a south London hospital. 
Pictures of the crash emerged online showing a number 53 double-decker bus to Lambeth North with a smashed windscreen. Man hit by bus just now, Lambeth Palace Rd, central London. Police who already present on parliament cordon now dealing with casualty pic.twitter.com/Vv3j8rwEDl — Charles Shoebridge (@ShoebridgeC) March 23, 2017 
The images also show officers, who were reportedly already in the area while on patrol following the London attack on Wednesday, treating the pedestrian. Crash: Pedestrian hit by bus near Lambeth Palace (Twitter/@ ShoebridgeC ) 
The road was closed and traffic was diverted until around 10.45am. 
A Met spokeswoman said: “Officers attended and found a pedestrian in collision with a bus. 
“No arrests have been made. Enquiries continue." More about:
